page.title: 14Rogart - Farming (Crofting)
page.content: Crofting is hard but enjoyable work. Mr Macdonald has 15ha. of rough grazing and 8ha. of arable land. On this land, he keeps cows and sheep. He has his own rams but hires a bull from the Department of Agriculture and Fisheries for Scotland. Daily, Mr Macdonald has to care for his animals. In spring and summer, he has to cultivate his land. July is the busiest month. Then he has to clip and dip his sheep, gather in his peats and gather in his hay. All Mr Macdonald's family help him on the croft. Even though he is so busy on the croft, he has a full-time job as well. Mr Macdonald is one of the local postmen.
